availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Stuart (Lincoln County, Tennessee, physician and asst surg 2nd Ky Cav USA)

body.p: Lincoln County, Tennessee, physician and soldier. Tennessee native. Son of William Stewart and Nancy Stewart. Physician in Lincoln County, Tennessee, in 1860. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as assistant surgeon from September 9, 1861, to June 18, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Lincoln County, District 20, p. 171.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 46.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Application #1150783, Certificate #883147.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0022.
